snippet: Jim Johnson, who set a Baltimore record with 51 saves this season, gave up a game-tying home run to Raul Ibanez, and Brian Matusz surrendered the winner.
abstract: Baltimore Orioles once-flawless bullpen opens the door for the New York Yankees in Game 3 of American League division series; Jim Johnson, who set team record with 51 saves this season, gives up game-tying home run to Yankees designate hitter Raul Ibanez, and Brian Matusz surrenders the winner.
lead_paragraph: Jim Johnson, who set a Baltimore record with 51 saves this season, gave up a game-tying home run to Raul Ibanez, and Brian Matusz surrendered the winner.

headline.seo: Orioles’ Once-Flawless Bullpen Opens Door for Yankees
headline.main: Orioles’ Once-Flawless Bullpen Opens the Door for the Yanks
headline.print_headline: With Another Misstep, Closer Opens the Door for the Yanks
